articles.author: Laila Bassam, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Hezbollah's flexible chain of command, together with its extensive tunnel network and a vast arsenal of missiles and weapons it has bolstered over the past year, is helping it weather unprecedented Israeli strikes, three sources familiar with the Lebanese militant group's operations said.
articles.title: Hezbollah's tunnels and flexible command weather Israel's deadly blows

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Lebanon's Hezbollah said on Wednesday it fired a rocket targeting Mossad spy agency headquarters near Tel Aviv, which it blamed for the assassination of its leaders and the blowing up communications devices used by its members, in a new escalation that moved the arch-foes closer to full-fledged war.
articles.title: Lebanon's Hezbollah says it launched rocket targeting Mossad base near Tel Aviv

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia has established a weapons programme in China to develop and produce long-range attack drones for use in the war against Ukraine, according to two sources from a European intelligence agency and documents reviewed by Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Russia has secret war drones project in China, intel sources say

articles.author: Simon Lewis, Michelle Nichols
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy told the United Nations Security Council on Tuesday that the war between Russia and Ukraine cannot be calmed by talks alone, but that Moscow must be forced into peace.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy tells UN Russia must be forced into peace

articles.author: Ju-Min Park, Eduardo Baptista
articles.description: China has implemented new deportation centres, hundreds of smart facial-recognition cameras and extra boat patrols along its 1,400-kilometre frontier with North Korea.
articles.title: 'Fishing net': Police quotas, surveillance trap North Koreans in China

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The man accused of staking out Donald Trump’s Florida golf course with a rifle was indicted on Tuesday on a charge of attempted assassination of a political candidate as prosecutors alleged he intended to kill the former U.S. president, CNN reported.
articles.title: US charges suspected Trump gunman with attempted assassination, CNN reports

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A raging wildfire filled Ecuador's capital of Quito with smoke and threatened homes on Tuesday as authorities rushed to control the blaze at a time when a historic drought has stretched resources and patience.
articles.title: Wildfire rages in Ecuador's drought-stricken capital

articles.author: Nerijus Adomaitis
articles.description: Norway's security police (PST) have begun a preliminary investigation into reports that a Norwegian-owned company was linked to the sale of pagers to Lebanese militant group Hezbollah that exploded last week, a police lawyer told Reuters.
articles.title: Norway starts probe into reported links to exploding pagers in Lebanon

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia said on Wednesday that a plan by Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy to force it to make peace was a "fatal mistake" that would have consequences for Kyiv.
articles.title: Kremlin says Zelenskiy is making "fatal mistake" by trying to force it to make peace

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tunisia's coast guard has recovered the bodies of 13 sub-Saharan African migrants off the coasts of Salakta and Chebba towns, a judicial official said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Tunisia coast guard recovers bodies of 13 African migrants
